text: Beriz Belkić (born 8 September 1946) is a Bosnian former politician. From 30 March 2001 until 28 October 2002, he was the 4th Bosniak Member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Belkić graduated from the faculty of economics with the University of Sarajevo, in his hometown. He served on various administrative positions, on municipal, cantonal and state level. His first serious political position was that of Prime Minister of Sarajevo Canton, staying on that position from 12 November 1998 until 15 February 2001. Following the elections in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Belkić was elected as a parliament member in the House of Representatives. On 30 March 2001, he was elected by the parliament to replace Halid Genjac as a substitute member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, following the withdrawal of Alija Izetbegović. Following the elections in 2006, Belkić was again a member of the House of Representatives, this time until November 2014. He was a founding member of the Party for Bosnia and Herzegovina. ==External links== *Website of the Presidency Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:People from Sarajevo Category:Bosniaks of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina Muslims Category:University of Sarajevo alumni Category:Party for Bosnia and Herzegovina politicians Category:Members of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Chairmen of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Members of the House of Representatives (Bosnia and Herzegovina) Category:Chairmen of the House of Representatives (Bosnia and Herzegovina)
title: Beriz Belkić
